server

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    class that handles the clients and their messages, sends them to the correct user. The class determine action depending on the header in the message
    Author:
    Anders Qvist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClientHandler(java.net.Socket socket)
      constructor that opens the streams for input and output

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClientListener(CallbackToServer listener)
      method that connect the listener(the server) with client objects to tell server to update the ui via the controller when someone connects or disconnects
      void connected()
      put the newly connected client in the allconnected and the available lists
      void disconnected()
      removes the client from the 3 lists of users, the available to play, the players and the list of all clients
      void forceDisconnect(java.lang.String userToDisconnect)
      method that force disconnects the user recieved as a string, informs opponent if one exists that the player disconnected and removes the user from the lists. also adds the event to the log and tells controller to update the ui.
      void run()
      run method that receives objects from the client and determine what to do with them depending on the header in the message received.
      void send(java.lang.Object obj)
      the send method that send whatever object that is to be sent
      void sendToOpponent(java.lang.Object obj)
      Sends the object to the opponent, if there is one.
      void updateAvailable()
      method that sends a list of users to all connected users

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • forceDisconnect

        public void forceDisconnect(java.lang.String userToDisconnect)
        method that force disconnects the user recieved as a string, informs opponent if one exists that the player disconnected and removes the user from the lists. also adds the event to the log and tells controller to update the ui. Sockets and streams are also closed * @param userToDisconnect the user to disconnect
